summary: Chili peppers come in many colors and sizes, like green bird's eye and red cayenne. They are fruits from the Capsicum plant family and are spicy due to a substance called capsaicin. Chili peppers are used in many cuisines to add heat and flavor. They originated in Central or South America and were brought to Europe in the 16th century. Now, they are grown worldwide for food and medicine. Common types include Capsicum annuum and baccatum.
title: Chili pepper
